title: Why do people get married and have kids when they're still in college?
self_text: I mean, don't you want to finish your education before starting a family?  It seems like there are so many opportunities for young adults to be successful without having to start a family until later in life. What's the point of sacrificing your career goals just to raise a kid?

title: Why are we so bad at math?
self_text: I mean, it's the most basic thing humans have to do in their lives but no one can seem to master it. It's like we're stuck in a loop and just can't get out of it.  I'm not talking about calculus or anything complicated like that. I'm talking about stuff like counting up to ten or adding two numbers together. It's weird how something as simple as that is so hard for so many people.

title: What's the best way to keep a water bottle from getting moldy?
self_text: I just got an insulated water bottle that is supposed to be for keeping drinks cold, but it also keeps them warm so you can have hot coffee or tea in it as well. However, after using it for about a week, I noticed some green mold growing on the bottom of the bottle. It’s not all over, just around the bottom. This happened with my last water bottle, and it was exactly the same situation.   I tried washing it thoroughly with soap and water, but it still came back again.  It’s not like I didn’t wash it immediately when I first used it; I washed it right away. So what should I do? Is there anything else I can use to clean it better, such as bleach?  Is this something I need to worry about?  If so, how long does it take for it to start forming mold again? How often should I clean it? Should I buy another one? Please help!

title: Can you have a relationship with a friend and be in love with them?
self_text: I've had a crush on my best friend for years but I never said anything about it because she has a boyfriend so I didn't want to ruin our friendship. We just went through the breakup, and now I feel like I can tell her how I really feel. But I don't know if she feels the same way or if she thinks that I'm being too forward. So what do you guys think?

title: How do you know when you've been scammed?
self_text: I recently got scammed on eBay and, for the life of me, I don’t know how it happened.  I didn’t click any links or download anything. The only thing that was different about this transaction was the seller had a very unusual username (a string of numbers) and used an image of a random landscape as their profile picture.  The item itself was legitimate – it was a rare comic book in excellent condition that I’d been searching for for years.  But the seller wouldn’t respond to my emails, and then suddenly, the listing disappeared from eBay.  I contacted eBay support, but they told me there was nothing they could do because the seller had already closed the account.  It’s been three weeks since the transaction, and I’m still out $200.  How would I even go about finding them?

title: Why don't they make a "clean" version of the original?
self_text: You know, like you could buy a clean copy for $50 and an original for $200. I am not saying the original is bad but it has a lot more dirt on it than the other version.

title: What is a good way to use all of my time?
self_text: I have 20 hours per week and I want to spend them on something that will make me feel good about myself, but not like work.  I don't want to just waste it on TV or playing video games because those things are fun for a little while, then I start to get bored again.

title: What is the difference between a "dog" and a "wolf?"
self_text: I've been watching dog documentaries lately and they keep saying that all dogs are descended from wolves, but how does that work? Are all dogs wolves?  Are some dogs just the result of domesticating a wolf?  Are there different types of wolves, like there are different breeds of dogs?  What about hyenas?

title: Why are there so many people who hate me?
self_text: I’ve been getting harassed online for months now and it is truly affecting my mental health. It has gotten to the point that I don't want to use social media anymore, but I have friends and family on these platforms.  I am only asking if anyone can offer some advice on how to deal with this situation. I just wish they would stop.

title: What is the best way to make a chicken burger?
self_text: I want to cook a good chicken burger but don't know how

title: How do you make a fake, easy to fake, or obvious fake phone call?
self_text: I'm not looking for how to trick someone into thinking it's someone else, I want to know what is the easiest way to fake a phone call so that people don't realize it's fake.

title: Why is the internet always so annoying and stressful?
self_text: I've been using the internet for over a decade, but lately it feels like it's just constantly trying to get me frustrated.  Every time I go online, there are new scams, trolls, or drama going on.  It makes me want to log off completely and never use the internet again.  Is that normal?

title: How can you beat a super rich man?
self_text: I'm trying to get some money and don't know how.  I'm not sure if I should invest, or start my own business.

title: How can I make a better, more interesting and diverse group of friends?
self_text: I have a few close friends that I love but I want to expand my circle and meet new people. However, my current friend group is a bunch of people who like the same things as me (e.g., video games, sports, etc.) so it's hard to find someone to go out with when my friends are busy.  How do you diversify your social circles and meet new people without having to just assume they share some of your interests?  Do you always meet new people at events, or is there another method?

title: Why do people on the internet say that it is wrong to take a screenshot of someone else's phone?
self_text: I was just looking up how to copy and paste something onto my computer, but when i searched for "how to get text from someone else's phone" all i found were articles about why it is wrong to take screenshots of other people's phones.  Is there anything specific about taking a screenshot of another person's phone that makes it so bad?  If so, what is it about the act itself that makes it such a bad thing?

title: How can I get a refund for the last movie I watched?
self_text: Okay, so when I was watching the movie "The Godfather" on Netflix, it wasn't available in my country to watch, but then it was added again a few days later and now it isn't available again because of some licensing issue.  I am not sure if I should call customer service or just go with the loss. The main reason why I am calling is because I want a refund for the movie.

title: What’s the most offensive thing you’ve ever been called?
self_text: It doesn't have to be related to your race, gender, religion or sexuality, it can be anything else!

title: What is a good, easy recipe to make with leftover pork shoulder?
self_text: I've been cooking the same pork shoulder for over a year and have no idea what to do with it after I cook it.  I usually just throw it in a sandwich or eat it as-is.  What are some recipes that don't require a ton of work?

title: What is the best way to get rid of a single blackhead?
self_text: I have had a single blackhead on my nose that has been there for about three weeks now. I've tried some stuff, but nothing seems to be working. I was wondering if you could give me any advice on how to get rid of it.

title: What is the difference between a 'fat' and a 'thin' person?
self_text: Is it just that fat people have more mass than thin people, or is there something else involved?  I can't understand why they are called fat.  If someone is obese, what does that mean?   Is there a weight limit?  How much weight do you have to be to qualify as overweight?

title: Why are the people of Europe so obsessed with drinking wine?
self_text: I don't get it. They have beer, and some really good vodka, but they drink wine like it's a religion.  I just don't understand why it's so much more popular than other alcoholic beverages.

title: Why do people who use the term "pussy" as a derogatory term for women usually also have really big necks?
self_text: I'm just wondering if there is any correlation between those two things, or if it is just a coincidence.

title: How many people in a country have a mental disorder?
self_text: I'm trying to understand how many people in the US or UK have a mental disorder, and what percentage of the population that is.  I'm assuming it's more than 10%, but I don't know for sure.

title: How can you be sure a person is not a scammer?
self_text: If I see someone on Reddit who has a lot of followers and they are asking for money, how can I be sure that the person is not a scammer? Like if I was to go into my bank account and send them money, would they actually give me the money back? What are some things to look out for in order to avoid scammers?

title: What are the benefits of having a pet?
self_text: Why would I want to have a pet, it's so much work! It is like owning a baby for all your life but you can’t change diapers.   I am going to go into more details on what makes me not want a pet.  I don’t think my current lifestyle is suitable for having a pet and if it were to happen at any point in the future, there would be no way I could get away with it because I work from home. If I was to own a pet, how would I be able to do that, or would it even be possible? And what kind of people would be willing to take care of them?   I really need an answer and also some explanation.

title: If you could have any superpower, what would it be and why?
self_text: I'm not asking about practical powers like flying or super strength, but rather something that might just make life easier.

title: How do I get over the fear of being watched?
self_text: It is hard to be around other people when you feel like everyone is watching and judging you.  I hate going outside as much as possible because of this, and it's starting to affect my ability to hold a job.  I don't have any physical problems or mental health issues, just an intense need to be noticed by people who are judging me.  How can I get rid of this feeling?

title: Why are people so obsessed with these things?
self_text: I saw a video about how people can use the “magic” of some specific item to enhance their life, or even make money from it. Some examples include crystals, tarot cards, and meditation. People will spend thousands on something that has no basis in reality just to increase their chances of getting a good life.   I don’t get why people believe stuff like this. Is there any evidence of this actually working? How is anyone able to afford these items?

title: How do you think the world will change in 20 years?
self_text: I have no idea what to expect so I thought it would be good to get some outside perspectives.

title: Why do people like the way that they sound when they speak?
self_text: I have been trying to figure out why people think their voices are so nice or cool and I just don't get it. It sounds weird to me, but what is it about other peoples voices that makes them want to hear them talk?

title: Why are the "100%" marks on things always just a little off?
self_text: I mean, if something is 99% complete, then it's not 100% complete. And if it is 100% complete, why are they still marking it as 100%? It makes no sense and is misleading.

title: What is the best way to make money online?
self_text: I have a lot of free time and am looking for ways to make extra income, but it's hard to know where to start. There are so many options that seem like scams or require too much investment.  I'm not afraid to put in work, but I also don't want to waste my time on something that won't pay out.

title: I'm a teenager, but my parents think I'm an adult so they don't let me use my phone and internet for too long.  I feel like it's really unfair because some of my friends are using the internet to do school stuff and get jobs while I can't.  How do you guys deal with this situation?
self_text: I know it sounds dramatic, but it is hard to not be able to connect with my friends as easily or do anything productive online when my parents won't let me.  It makes me feel like they aren't trusting me.

title: Do you think that people who watch a lot of violence and gore in media are more likely to be violent themselves?
self_text: I'm just asking for opinions, and it is possible there is no correlation.  I have watched quite a bit of horror movies growing up, but I have never been violent towards anyone or anything. My mom says it has made me desensitized to violence. What do you all think?

title: How does a body know to stop growing?
self_text: I'm asking because when people say they're in the "growth phase" of their lives, is that just a metaphor? If so, what are the actual biological processes involved?

title: Why is it called "Reddit"?
self_text: I mean, what did the founders of Reddit do?  It's not like they were building a train station or something.   Was there some kind of code involved?  I know that "Reddit" is a reference to the Matrix, but how does that connect to the website itself?

title: Is it ok to call a priest a jerk?
self_text: I was at church and the priest kept saying that things are not "as simple as they look" or "you have to think about all the details". He said the same thing over and over again when people asked him questions. At first, he sounded nice but his tone changed after a few minutes.  I didn't want to be rude, but I felt like I was wasting my time because every question got thrown back in my face.

title: How to make a really good white sauce?
self_text: I know how to make a basic white sauce but my sauces always end up bland and watery.  What are the best tips for making a creamy, flavorful white sauce that isn't too thick or runny?  I want it to be great as a base for pasta dishes like Alfredo, creamed chicken/broccoli etc.

title: Is it more common to die of a gunshot wound than being shot?
self_text: I’m not saying that the bullet is what killed me, but I just want to know if there's more deaths from bullets than people are killed by them in general

title: Why do people hate on the last of us part 2?
self_text: I just finished it, and was genuinely moved by it.

title: What is the difference between a "good" and "bad" person?
self_text: I’m not asking about morality, ethics, or moral standards. Just what does it mean to be a good or bad person?

title: Why is the word "crap" a more commonly used and accepted word than other similarly offensive words?
self_text: I'm not saying that these words are bad, but they’re more often used to describe something as simply “bad” or “awful”.  Like, you could say "This food tastes like crap", but if someone says, “This music sounds like crap,” it just feels so weird because “sound” isn’t an object. Like why not use ‘terrible’ or ‘horrible’ instead?   Why do we just default to “crap”?

title: How to use the "new" app store?
self_text: I've been using my phone for years, but just downloaded it and am completely lost as to where things are. Can someone explain the basics of how apps work on the new store?  What's a download?  Does that mean you have to pay for everything?  And what is a profile?

title: If a tree falls in the forest and nobody is around to hear it, does it still make a sound?
self_text: I’m not asking about philosophy or if something exists without an observer. I'm asking what constitutes a "sound" - whether that is the vibration of air molecules from the impact, or just the sensation/experience you feel when those vibrations reach your ears.

title: If you want to get a really good job and have a high paying career, do you need to be at the top of your class in high school?
self_text: I'm just wondering if it is possible to make millions of dollars with being average or even below average in highschool, or if you are more likely to succeed with being an exceptional student.

title: Is it okay to smoke a cigarette in the car?
self_text: I am driving to work and there is an open window and I'm smoking, will that be harmful to my health?

title: How do you make a simple, cheap, and effective way to keep food fresh in the fridge?
self_text: I have a fridge that's pretty old. It keeps things cold but it doesn't really keep them fresh or long after they've been taken out of their container. So I was wondering if there was anything I could add to my fridge to help with this.

title: How do I tell my mom that she is wrong?
self_text: I'm not saying she's always wrong, but sometimes she makes things up and just says them as facts.  It’s very frustrating to have to challenge her on everything, especially because she is a grown woman with more experience than me.   I know she doesn't mean to be annoying, but it’s happening too often.  What should I say to her so that she will listen to me?

title: Why are all the new cars in the US so big?
self_text: I'm not saying they are bad, but why do they have to be so huge?  They don't even need that much space for passengers or cargo.

title: How do I make a better/more efficient website?
self_text: I am trying to start my own blog and need advice on how to make it more efficient for the user, and that will increase my views.  I’m not a coder or anything so I can’t really build myself something super complex.   How should I go about this?  I want to make it look good but also be easy to navigate.   What kind of things should I focus on?

title: How to get rid of something that you don’t want, but it is still there?
self_text: I just got a new apartment and have to get rid of all the stuff in it, and there are so many things I don't want, but can’t bring myself to throw away because of sentimental reasons. Is there any way to get over these things? I feel like I'm stuck forever.

title: Is it normal for a car to be full of different types of people?
self_text: I was just driving and I saw a black jeep with some white guys in the front seats and two Asian women in the back seats, which is not unusual but then there was an older black man sitting on the passenger side of the car with his girlfriend next to him, who was asian as well.  I thought that was pretty weird because it's not very common for a vehicle to have so many diverse people in it.

title: What is the difference between a ‘vibe’ and an ‘aura’?
self_text: I was talking to my friend about how we feel like we can sense other people's emotions and moods, without actually being told anything. She says she feels a ‘vibe’, and I just don’t know what that means or what it has to do with anything. Is there a real difference?

title: How do you keep your ears warm on a windy day?
self_text: I am wearing two pairs of earwarmers, but my ears are still cold and numb after just ten minutes.   I've tried different materials (wool, fleece, etc.), and they all feel the same way.  Is there anything else I can do?

title: How can I get rid of my old, unused keys?
self_text: I've got a bunch of old, unused keys that are just lying around my house. They are from different apartments and houses I have lived in over the years. Some of them don't even work anymore.  Is it safe to throw these keys away? Or is there any other way to dispose of them?

title: Why is it not possible to make a black hole out of a small amount of matter?
self_text: Like, I can see how a massive amount of matter can collapse into a black hole, but why does it require so much matter? If you had just a small amount, wouldn't gravity be enough to pull it in and form a small black hole? What is the point of needing so much mass?

title: What is the difference between a real gun and a fake gun?

I've been watching too much action movies lately.  I wanted to know if there's a big difference between them because I don't want to buy something that could cause harm.

title: Why is it called "The Dead Zone" when there are no zombies?

title: What's the deal with the color of a cat?

title: How do you stop someone from being so judgmental?
self_text: I've been trying to stop judging people, but sometimes it's hard not to judge them when they have bad habits or are mean/rude to others. It’s like a reflex that I can’t seem to shake off, and it makes me feel guilty. It doesn’t help when they act all sanctimonious about how “good” they are.

title: What are some ways to make a good impression when you just met someone?
self_text: I'm not trying to be cocky or anything, but the way people talk about me makes me think they don't like me.  I've been with my girlfriend for almost a year now and she says I am the best boyfriend ever, but I still have doubts about how I come off to other people.  I'm not sure if I come across as rude, arrogant, or something else.   I have a pretty normal personality, so it's hard to imagine what I'd do wrong.

title: What is the difference between a white and black person?
self_text: I’ve been watching a lot of tv lately, and I'm trying to understand how people differ.  I was just thinking about it today as I watched The Wire.

title: What is the difference between a ‘bitch’ and a ‘slut’?
self_text: I have been reading so many articles that make these two words interchangeable, but they don’t seem to be. Like if someone says “that girl is a bitch” then what does it mean?  If someone says “that girl is a slut”, then what does it mean? It seems like a lot of women who are actually kind and lovely get labeled as a ‘bitch’.
